intro: Hieracium croceum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it often grows in meadows and grassy areas. Hieracium croceum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its resilience to moderate grazing.
